Name: Aesop
Description: Beauty brand, owned by L'Oreal.
Reason: Aesop is a brand owned by L'Oreal, which is a 'warm friend of Israel'. After sending a letter to the Arab League with information helping the boycott, they paid a $1.4m fine and issued an apology, before fostering a new relationship with Israel, with heavy investment and even operating a factory in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Aesop products. Don't sell Aesop products. Don't work for L'Oreal Groupe.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty.

Name: Ahava
Description: Dead Sea mineral products.
Reason: Ahava is an Israeli company which operates its manufacturing facilities in Occupied Palestine, stealing resources from the Dead Sea.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Ahava products. Don't sell Ahava products.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics.

Name: Amika
Description: Hair care brand.
Reason: Manufactured on occupied Palestinian land.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Amika products. Don't sell Amika products.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products. Lush cosmetics.

Name: Aussie
Description: Hair care brand.
Reason: Aussie is owned by Procter and Gamble, who opened an R&D center in Tel Aviv, Occupied Palestine, in which it invests $2bn annually.
How to Boycott: Don't buy aussie products. Don't sell aussie products. Don't work for aussie.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products. Lush cosmetics.

Name: Axe
Description: Deodorant brand.
Reason: Axe is owned by Unilever. Ben & Jerry's is also owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Axe products. Don't sell Axe products. Don't work for Unilever.
Alternatives: Unbranded oil based fragrances. Lush cosmetics. Supermarket own brand products. Sunnamusk.

How to Boycott: Don't buy Bath&Body Works products. Don't work for Bath&Body Works.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics. Unbranded oil based perfumes. Sunnamusk.

Name: Unilever
Description: Nutrition, healthcare and personal care product manufacturer and distributer.
Reason: Ben & Jerry's is owned by Unilever. When Ben & Jerry's decided to stop selling its products in Israel, Unilever sold off the Israeli distribution rights to Avi Zinger to circumvent their decision and to force Ben & Jerry's brand name to continue selling in Israel.
How to Boycott: Dont buy Unilever products. Don't sell Unilever products.
Alternatives: Supermarket own brand products. Eg. Aldi, Lidl.

Name: Urban Decay
Description: Beauty brand, owned by L'Oreal.
Reason: Urban Decay is a brand owned by L'Oreal, which is a 'warm friend of Israel'. After sending a letter to the Arab League with information helping the boycott, they paid a $1.4m fine and issued an apology, before fostering a new relationship with Israel, with heavy investment and even operating a factory in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Urban Decay products. Don't sell Urban Decay products. Don't work for L'Oreal Groupe.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty.

Name: Valentino Beauty
Description: Partnership between fashion house Valentino and L'Oreal to produce their beauty range.
Reason: Valentino Beauty is a partnership with L'Oreal, which is a 'warm friend of Israel'. After sending a letter to the Arab League with information helping the boycott, they paid a $1.4m fine and issued an apology, before fostering a new relationship with Israel, with heavy investment and even operating a factory in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Valentino Beauty products. Don't sell Valentino Beauty products. Don't work for L'Oreal Groupe.
Alternatives: Lush cosmetics. Huda beauty.

Name: Victorias Secret
Description: Victorias Secret and PINK are lingerie, loungewear and beauty brands.
Reason: Les Wexner who owns L Brands, the parent company of Victorias Secret, is a staunch ally of Israel, and a long time business partner of Jeffrey Epstein, the convicted child trafficker.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Victorias Secret products, including the Pink brand. Don't work for Victorias Secret. Call out Victorias Secret models for being complicit.
Alternatives: Non designer brand underwear.

Name: Viktor & Rolf Beauty
Description: Partnership between fashion house Viktor & Rolf and L'Oreal to produce their beauty range.
Reason: Viktor & Rolf Beauty is a partnership with L'Oreal, which is a 'warm friend of Israel'. After sending a letter to the Arab League with information helping the boycott, they paid a $1.4m fine and issued an apology, before fostering a new relationship with Israel, with heavy investment and even operating a factory in Occupied Palestine.
How to Boycott: Don't buy Viktor & Rolf Beauty products. Don't sell Viktor & Rolf Beauty products. Don't work for L'Oreal Groupe.
Alternatives: Unbranded oil based perfumes. Sunnamusk.

Name: Walmart
Description: American multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores.
Reason: Walmart was quick to pledge $1m to Israeli victims and condemned Hamas, however did not donate anything towards charities operating in Gaza for the victims of Israel's genocide.
How to Boycott: Dont shop at Walmart. Don't work for Walmart.
Alternatives: Local small supermarkets.
